Padi Help
 

 

Main window:

When launched, Padi will popup a main window with two areas. The menu area with menu buttons used to act on the application behavior. The chart area where data will be plotted. The chart area is empty until you connect to a data source. Once connected to a data source Padi will plot the content of the data source in the chart area. An update interval gives users a way to control data updates speed. The default update interval is five seconds, the low limit is one second.

 

     _______________________________________

 

Connecting to a data source:

In order to have something plotted in the chart area, you must connect to a data source. To do this you use the Open menu item in the File menu. A file chooser will popup. Go to the file you want Padi to use as the data source. The content of the data source will be plotted and the data source will be re-read every five seconds by default. A data source must respect the classical spreadsheet format, tabulations between columns and newline between lines. Each column will be printed as a different plot in the chart area. Padi will find out how many plots to create while reading the data source.

Plots are refreshed only if the data source still exists and/or new data are available from the source since last update.

 

 

  Top

    _______________________________________

 

Interacting with the chart:

With the right button of the mouse one can popup a menu with many capabilities like zoom, grid, log axis etc … Before to use this mouse menu it is better to stop the plotting loop.

 

 Top

     _______________________________________

 

 

 

Changing display settings:

Use the Display Settings menu item from the Options menu to popup a dialog window from which you can add a chart title, add axis title.  This popup window is a modal window, which means it grabs the application focus.

 

Top

 

 _______________________________________

 

Changing data settings:

Use the Data Settings menu item in the Options menu to popup a dialog window. One can change the update interval, default is five seconds. The type of plot the application must create with data, only 1D chart is available at the moment. The datum and/or the curve not to plot. If datum is zero and a curve number is given, the whole curve will be skipped. Bounds checking is made at each reload. It is also possible to see in a other window some specific informations about the gate in the selected curve number. Check the checkbox to start the display window. Data are refreshed only if the data source still exists and/or new data are available from the source since last update.

 

 

Top

_______________________________________

 

 

Saving and printing charts:

 

It is possible on all platforms to print directly the chart to a printer. With the Print graph menu item from the Commands menu you will launch a dialog where you will choose the printer and change printing options you want. If you want a colored print, choose a color printer in the printers list. The printers in the printer list are all the printers the computer where Padi is running can print on.
